title: B minor harmonic dictation - secondary dominant

content.question: Before listening to the first playing, please look at the staff below. Notice that there are nine chords in the progression; the soprano and bass notes and the Roman numeral of the first chord are given. Remember to notate only the soprano and bass voices and to provide the numerals indicating the chords and their inversions. Now listen to the progression for the first time and begin working. Enter any notes as you prepare your response.

unit.text: 1: Music Fundamentals I - Pitch, Major Scales and Key Signatures, Rhythm, Meter, and Expressive Elements

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Notate the soprano and bass pitches of a performed harmonic progression in a major or minor key (may include chromatically altered pitches).
